title: Remake system is dumb
body:
Lost LP again because some dumbass voted no to a remake. For real, why arent they automatic ? who wants to play a whole game 4v5 except trolls ? 

This wastes so much time it's frustrating...{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

replies.body: I thought a remake only needed like 2-3 of the remaining players to vote yes? It's not unanimous, last I checked.
Even worse - sometimes you can't remake even if everyone would agree. Simply because it doesn't work.
Don't those runes that give you items still prevent the remake?  If so, that shit needs to be fixed.
Yep, the fucking biscuit still does that mess.

> [{quoted}](name=Bondy,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=5loEo1KA,comment-id=000600000000,timestamp=2018-09-14T17:41:33.183+0000)
>
> Yep, the fucking biscuit still does that mess.

wait...biscuit prevents remakes? Since when? Imma take them out of all my rune pages now lol

Yeah, a few weeks ago a guy forgot to swap champs in champ select. The game started, he's apologized and went DC immediately. We all started trolling, because "we're gonna remake" ... We couldn't because he's received a biscuit, hence it was counted as if he had bought items.

> [{quoted}](name=Bondy,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=5loEo1KA,comment-id=00060000000000000000,timestamp=2018-09-14T18:03:26.480+0000)

Oh that's so dumb!! Yeah I'm definitely taking it out. Not that I ever myself DC but in case i'm in a situation where someone else does.
THat might explain why the last couple normals they didn't do a remake
It's also completely untrue, according to Ritoers.
It happened to me with stopwatch.

You had a game where, one, an unmoving player had a stopwatch and, two, the game wasn't remade, as have others.  These two thing coinciding with each other does not mean they are (and they are not, Riot even checked).  And further, we also all know games where a remake did not occur and there was no stopwatch or similar items, yet for a reason, that's not seen as grounds for doubt
However, in a behaviour that is unfortunately common, people decided to just make up reasons to say it's the cause and present that as the facts even though it is not and they have no idea how the subject in question, the coding for this, works.

I can't recall any games where remake failed to work and someone didn't have one of those runes.  It's possible that it has happened to my opponents, but I can't know that.

I've had instances where someone came back seconds before or left only seconds before and the prompt didn't appear, but I figure that's because it requires a player to be in fountain for that time (not necessarily all of it, not totally clear on it).

It's possible it is something else and pure coincidence with me (I don't remake often).
I'm pretty sure it wasn't due to biscuits but because he made it into the game from the loading screen-- my understanding is remakes are only available if someone's client doesn't load into the game

That's so tragic

Why struggle for a maybe win, at a disadvantage, when you could just go into the next game and be on even grounds? And "winning" without him, What if the other team was derping because it was 5v3? You know nothing of what was going on, except it was a 5v4 with an option to end the game and go to the next one. That is all you know. I could see if the guy D/C DURING the game and there was no remake available. But your logic is stupid and flawed.
Because you were put in the game, your team decided to play it out, you don't get to decide to leave that game.

You didn't decide to go in to a 5v4. Your logic is stupid and flawed. They chose to risk taking a loss over just going to the next game. No reason to want to play with people that oblivious to the world. Decision making isn't their strong point.

It's dumb because if someone connects for 3 minutes and leaves then there is actually no remake and you'll lose LP.
I think that remake should happen after 7 minutes of that player being AFK and the LP gains/losses scale down based on game length.
Yeah its pretty stupid, not only that but if someone DCs a few minutes into the game you are stuck losing LP, I'm about to derank because a player disconnected at level 2.

Remake should be available starting at 1 minute instead of 3 minutes because what if the dc comes back at 2:99? That 2:99 minute dc most likely makes a big difference in lane and I don't want to deal with that.
